description.text:
The original Tai Heritage was designed to reflect the traditional hand-written style of the Tai Viet script that is treasured by the Tai people of Vietnam. This gives it its angular style and flowing lines, as opposed to the more rounded style used by Lao and some modern versions of Tai Viet.
The current Tai Heritage Pro provides coverage of the Tai Viet character reportoire encoded by Unicode 5.2. It uses both the SIL Graphite technology and OpenType for correct placement of combining marks (vowels and tones).
Two fonts from this typeface family are included in this release:
* Tai Heritage Pro Regular * Tai Heritage Pro Bold
For detailed documentation see the contents of the 'documentation' folder.
ChangeLog --------- (This should list both major and minor changes, most recent first.)
2017 (SIL NRSI team) Tai Heritage Pro 2.600 - Three bug fixes related to makeing version 2.600 work in OT apps on Windows 10: -- Corrected spelling of "tavt" script tag in OT code. -- Changed ccmp feature to rclt. -- Moved some OpenType lookups from mkmk feature to mark feature. -- Corrected minor discrepancies between OT and Graphite in the positioning of combining marks in the regular face. - Added WOFF versions of the fonts to the distribution.
2013 (SIL NRSI team) Tai Heritage Pro 2.510. (Limited release) - Tweaked positioning to avoid collisions in some multisyllable words.
2012 (SIL NRSI team) Tai Heritage Pro 2.500. - Graphite and OpenType rendering. - Regular and Bold face.
2009 (SIL NRSI team) Tai Heritage Pro 2.000. - Unicode encoded (v5.2) with Graphite rendering. - Regular face only.
2006-2008 (SIL NRSI team) Tai Heritage Design Review 1.6. - PUA encoded. - New glyphs added in order to provide the complete set of characters specified in the proposal to add Tai Viet to the Universal Character Set. - Graphite code added for positioning of combining marks. - Regular face only.
1995-1997 (SIL International Publishing Services) Tai Heritage 1.2. - First use of the Tai Heritage name for outline fonts based on the earlier Tai Dam bitmap font. - TrueType GX fonts released for Macintosh - Standard TrueType fonts released for Macintosh and Windows. - Included regular and bold faces.
1986-1987 (SIL Printing Arts Department) - Original Tai Dam bitmap fonts (regular and bold weights) developed based on the artwork of Faah Baccam, of Des Moines, IA.
